com.almasb.fxgl.entity

Class GameEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.ents.Entity
      • com.almasb.fxgl.entity.GameEntity

  • public class GameEntity
extends com.almasb.ents.Entity
    Entity that guarantees to have Type, Position, Rotation, BoundingBox and View components. Provides methods to conveniently access commonly used features.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • rotateBy

        public final void rotateBy(double angle)
        Rotate entity view by given angle clockwise. To rotate counter clockwise use a negative angle value. Note: this doesn't affect hit boxes. For more accurate collisions use PhysicsComponent.
        Parameters:
        angle - rotation angle in degrees

      • rotateToVector

        public final void rotateToVector(javafx.geometry.Point2D vector)
        Set absolute rotation of the entity view to angle between vector and positive X axis. This is useful for projectiles (bullets, arrows, etc) which rotate depending on their current velocity. Note, this assumes that at 0 angle rotation the scene view is facing right.
        Parameters:
        vector - the rotation vector / velocity vector

      • getWidth

        public final double getWidth()
        Returns:
